intro: Dichrotrichum praelongum, commonly known as the long-stemmed dichrotrichum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture. Dichrotrichum praelongum is known for its delicate appearance and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for ornamental purposes.
